snippet: Only a few days into August, summer on Mille Lacs Lake seemed to be over after a state agency banned walleye fishing, saying the annual quota had already been exceeded.
abstract: Decision by Minnesota Dept of Natural Resources to ban fishing of walleye in Mille Lacs Lake for remainder of season has sparked outcry among residents and business owners who say it will harm local economy; department says walleye population is dangerously low, prompting retorts that agency's management is to blame; walleye fishing is not only mainstay of local economy, but also of region's culture.
lead_paragraph: Only a few days into August, summer on Mille Lacs Lake seemed to be over after a state agency banned walleye fishing, saying the annual quota had already been exceeded.

headline.main: How Are Those Walleye Biting? On Minnesota Lake, They’re Not
headline.print_headline: A Minnesota Lake Loses Its Fish, and Its Lure
